Package com.teracloud.streams.dps

Interface StoreFactory

public interface StoreFactory
This is an interface for the store factory with the available methods declared here. A store factory implementation class will provide concrete logic for these methods. It is also the main entry point for the Time To Live (TTL) store functions. TTL based K/V pairs can be stored and retrieved without having to create a user specified store. Such K/V entries will be automatically deleted when their TTL expires. Only SPL primitive types, such as "rstring" and composite types, such as "map" are supported. Most user created store and TTL store operations (get, put, createStore) require specifying the name of the SPL type of the key and/or value in question, for example, To create a store with keys of type rstring and values of type boolean, you would need to do the following: 

	try {
	   //specify the SPL types for the keys and values in the store
	   String keyType = "rstring";
	   String valueType = "boolean";
	  Store  store = myStoreFactoryInstance.createOrGetStore("Java Test Store1", keyType, valueType);
	} catch (StoreFactoryException sfe) {
		// use	sfe.getErrorCode() and  sfe.getErrorMessage()) for more info
	}

  • Method Details

    • createStore

      Store createStore(String name, String keySplTypeName, String valueSplTypeName) throws StoreFactoryException
      Creates a new store with a given store name. The type of the key and value are the string names of any valid SPL primitive or composite types, such as 
      rstring, list<int32>
      .
      Parameters:
      name - name of the new store
      keySplTypeName - the name of the SPL type for the keys, e.g. rstring
      valueSplTypeName - name of the SPL type for the values, e.g. map<rstring,int32>
      Returns:
      the Store that was created.
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if the store could not be created Example: 
                
StoreFactory sf = DistributedStores.getStoreFactory();
Store store = null;
        try {
                store = sf.createStore("Java Test Store1", "boolean", "boolean");
                System.out.println("Created the Java Test Store1 with a storeId of " + store.getId()); 
        } catch (StoreFactoryException sfe) {
                throw sfe;
        }

    • createOrGetStore

      Store createOrGetStore(String name, String keySplTypeName, String valueSplTypeName) throws StoreFactoryException
      Create the new store if it does not already exist or return the store if it exists. The type of the key and value are the string names of any valid SPL primitive or composite types, such as 
      rstring, list<int32>
      .
      Parameters:
      name - name of the new store
      keySplTypeName - the name of the SPL type for the keys, e.g. 
      rstring
      valueSplTypeName - name of the SPL type for the values, e.g. 
       map<rstring,int32>
      Returns:
      the created or retrieved Store
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurs.

    • findStore

      Store findStore(String name) throws StoreFactoryException
      Finds a store with a given store name
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the store to look up
      Returns:
      a Store object representing the store, if it exists
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurred 
       
StoreFactory  sf = DistributedStores.getStoreFactory();
Store store = null;

try {
   store = sf.findStore("Java Test Store1");
} catch (StoreFactoryException sfe) {
   System.out.println("32) Unable to find the Java Test Store1. Error code = " +
      sfe.getErrorCode() + ", Error Msg = " + sfe.getErrorMessage());
}

    • removeStore

      boolean removeStore(Store store) throws StoreFactoryException
      Remove the given Store.
      Parameters:
      store - the Store to remove
      Returns:
      true if the store existed and was successfully removed
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurs

    • putTTL

      <T1, T2> boolean putTTL(T1 key, T2 value, int ttl, String keySplTypeName, String valueSplTypeName) throws StoreFactoryException
      Put a TTL based K/V pair stored in the global area of the back-end data store. Example: 
               
StoreFactory  sf = DistributedStores.getStoreFactory();
RString myKey = new RString(""), myValue = new RString("");
myKey = new RString("New Jersey");
myValue = new RString("Trenton");

try {
   // Put a K/V pair with 5 seconds of TTL.  
   // We must provide the SPL type names for our key and value as literal strings as shown below.
   sf.putTTL(myKey, myValue, 5, "rstring", "rstring");
} catch (StoreFactoryException sfe) {
   System.out.println("Unexpected error in putTTL. Error code=" + 
      sfe.getErrorCode() + ", Error msg=" + sfe.getErrorMessage());
}
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the key to store
      T2 - value to associate with the given key
      Parameters:
      ttl - The amount of time, in seconds, to keep the pair in the store. It will be automatically removed after ttl seconds. A value of '0' means that this pair will be in the store indefinitely until manually removed via removeTTL.
      keySplTypeName - name of the SPL type of the key
      value - the value to insert
      valueSplTypeName - name of the SPL type of the value
      Returns:
      true on success.
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occured

    • putTTL

      <T1, T2> boolean putTTL(T1 key, T2 value, int ttl, String keySplTypeName, String valueSplTypeName, boolean encodeKey, boolean encodeValue) throws StoreFactoryException
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException

    • putTTL

      <T1, T2> boolean putTTL(T1 key, T2 value, int ttl, String keySplTypeName, String valueSplTypeName, int[] storedKeyValueSize, boolean encodeKey, boolean encodeValue) throws StoreFactoryException
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException

    • getTTL

      <T1> Object getTTL(T1 key, String keySplTypeName, String valueSplTypeName) throws StoreFactoryException
      Get a K/V pair with TTL (Time To Live in seconds) into the global area of the back-end data store.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - key to lookup
      Parameters:
      keySplTypeName - name of the SPL type of the key
      valueSplTypeName - name of the SPL type of the value
      Returns:
      the value if it exists
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurred 
       
 myComplexKey = new HashMap<String, Integer>();     
 myComplexKey.put("Apple", (int)1);
 myComplexKey.put("Orange", (int)2);
 try {
  Tuple myComplexValue = (Tuple)sf.getTTL(myComplexKey, "map<ustring,uint32>", "tuple<list<rstring> tickers>");
  System.out.println("TTL based K/V pair is read successfully from the global store. Key=" + myComplexKey + ", Value=" + myComplexValue);
 } catch (StoreFactoryException sfe) {
        System.out.println("Unexpected error in reading the K/V pair for " + myComplexKey + ". Error code=" + 
                sfe.getErrorCode() + ", Error msg=" + sfe.getErrorMessage());
}

      StoreFactoryException

      <T1> boolean removeTTL(T1 key, String keySplTypeName) throws StoreFactoryException
      Remove a TTL based K/V pair stored in the global area of the back-end data store.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - the key to remove
      Parameters:
      keySplTypeName - name of the key's SPL type
      Returns:
      true on success
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurred

      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException

    • hasTTL

      <T1> boolean hasTTL(T1 key, String keySplTypeName) throws StoreFactoryException
      Check if a TTL based K/V pair for a given key exists in the global area of the back-end data store.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - an object of the type specified when creating the store.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to look up
      keySplTypeName - the name of the type of the key, e.g. "rstring"
      Returns:
      whether or not the key exists
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurs.

      Throws:

      String[] getDetailsAboutThisMachine() throws StoreFactoryException

      Returns:
      an array containing the machine name, Linux OS version, and CPU architecture of the current machine, in that order.
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurs

    • runDataStoreCommand

      boolean runDataStoreCommand(String cmd) throws StoreFactoryException
      Run native commands on the chosen back-end data store.
      Parameters:
      cmd - the command to run, e.g. "set foo bar"
      Returns:
      true on success, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if running the command failed.

    • runDataStoreCommand

      String runDataStoreCommand(int cmdType, String httpVerb, String baseUrl, String apiEndpoint, String queryParams, String jsonRequest, long[] httpResponseCode) throws StoreFactoryException
      This is an advanced function that can be used to execute arbitrary back-end data store two way native commands for database technologies that work with cURL. A HTTP request is sent to the server and the response is saved in the jsonResponse paramter. This function is not supported with Redis. Therefore, this function can only be used with database technologies that are currently not officially supported by Streams, such as HBase. See the samples for this toolkit for a detailed example.
      Parameters:
      cmdType - 1 or 2 for Cloudant database or document type API, respectively
      httpVerb - HTTP command, e.g. GET, POST, e.t.c. COPY is not supported.
      baseUrl - For the public cloud based Cloudant service, it must be in this format: http://user:password@user.cloudant.com For the "Cloudant Local" on-premises infrastructure, it must be in this format: http://user:password@XXXXX where XXXXX is a name or IP address of your on-premises "Cloudant Local" load balancer machine. NOTE: If you give an empty string for the URL, then the Cloudant server configured in the SPL project directory's etc/no-sql-kv-store-servers.cfg file will be used.
      apiEndpoint - It should be a Cloudant DB or document related portion of the URL path as documented in the Cloudant APIs.
      queryParams - It should be in this format name1=value1&name2=value2
      jsonRequest - This is your JSON request needed by the Cloudant API you are executing. Please ensure that any special characters such as double quotes are properly escaped using the backslash character.
      httpResponseCode - On succesful execution of the command, then this will be the HTTP response code returned by the Cloudant server. You have to interpret the meaning of the returned HTTP response code and make your further logic from there.
      Returns:
      the json response string.
      Throws:
      StoreFactoryException - if an error occurs.

    • runDataStoreCommand

      String runDataStoreCommand(List<com.ibm.streams.operator.types.RString> cmdList) throws StoreFactoryException
      Throws:
